newsitem.title: GERMANY: First German Aug CPI data due Friday at 0700 GMT.
newsitem.headline: First German Aug CPI data due Friday at 0700 GMT.

text.p: The German state of Hesse said on Thursday that it would release provisional consumer price data for August on Friday at 0700 GMT.

In addition, the statistics offices of the west German states of Baden-Wuerttemberg and North Rhine-Westphalia said that Friday would be the earliest day on which they would release CPI data for the month.
A spokeswoman for the statistics office in Bavaria said the state would release the data either next Monday or Tuesday.
The reports from the four states are used to compute provisional west German consumer price data.
